meanings.definition: To cause (someone's skin) to become red and sore from the sun's rays.
meanings.sent1: She ended up sunburning her shoulders after spending the whole day at the beach.
meanings.sent2: Remember to apply sunscreen to prevent sunburning during your outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: Despite his fair skin, he kept sunburning every time he forgot to wear a hat.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat of the desert sun was sunburning the travelers' exposed skin.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sunburning tourists served as a reminder of the importance of sun protection.

meanings.definition: The act of getting a sunburn.
meanings.sent1: His painful sunburning was a result of forgetting to reapply sunscreen.
meanings.sent2: After a day at the beach, she noticed her sunburning had worsened.
meanings.sent3: The sunburning on his nose made him look like a comical clown.
meanings.sent4: The sunburning on her shoulders felt like a badge of honor from a day well spent outdoors.
meanings.sent5: The children's sunburning was a clear sign that they had enjoyed a day of fun in the sun.
